text:
Hello! I got the following error message response while importing associations via the api(v3):
{"status":"error","message":"this import is missing association ID columns for object types: [ObjectTypeId{legacyObjectType=DEAL}] (from foreign key columns: [AssociationSpec{associationCategory=HubSpot_DEFINED, associationTypeId=20}])","correlationId":"5ee602c6-1699-4112-9daf-2b4d9b218f65"}

Can anyone help me with this, What am I missing here. It worked fine while importing deals, products and contacts.

Here is the csv I am trying to Import and the code for the same.

Hi All.
While trying to Get Timeline Event Types using HubSpot API  <https://api.hubapi.com/integrations/v1/:application-id/timeline/event-types> with OAuth access token.

It's giving message  : _This oauth-token (CMPdnvz0LhIHRwMAAAAAGBiwtbQEIJ71ngYop8kOMhkAyEIiRP6xP-YR2yJ5eOrRs700hmO6kp2fOicAeyJH_wcMgAMAuAAAYH3OKAAAACAAGMAUEwAYgAEAwMMfBgEAACBCGQDIQiJEwOXABpEPbc_3FRvLLNTig5_8xfo) does not have proper permissions! (requires all of [developers-read])_

I could get list of events types when using developer hapikey but not when using OAuth access token.

Is there any way to get list of timeline events using Access token ,  because I could see only the hapikey in required parameters from below docs : _  <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/timeline/get-event-types>_
_Thanks!_

Hello everyone,
Is there a way of filling a HubSpot tempated email(Marketing) with external/dynamic data other than using the Transactional Email Add-on?

Hi there,
Is there a way to retrieve previous versions of a contact property using the CRM API?

Hi,
I am looking if sorting order is possible using field currentState  for blog-post/page/emails:

This usage has no effect
curl -X GET "<https://api.hubapi.com/blogs/v3/blog-posts?hapikey=API_KEY&order=-currentState>"
curl -X GET "<https://api.hubapi.com/blogs/v3/blog-posts?hapikey=API_KEY&order=currentState>"

and similar for <https://api.hubapi.com/content/api/v4/pages> and <https://api.hubapi.com/marketing-emails/v1/emails>
did anybody answer you on this ?
